metadata.title: Assessment Plan for OpenShift 4 based on ISA/IEC 62443-4-2 (SL-4 Target)

components.title: Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform 4
components.description: The target of this assessment is the production OpenShift cluster used for hosting industrial control system applications.

parts.name: rules-of-engagement
parts.prose: This assessment will be conducted during normal business hours. No disruptive testing will be performed without prior written consent from the system owner.

control-selections.description: All controls implemented by the OpenShift 4 component as defined in the component definition.

assessment-assets.description: The assets used to perform this assessment.

tasks.title: Assess Foundational Requirement 1: Identification and Authentication Control
Assess Foundational Requirement 5: Restricted Data Flow
Assess Foundational Requirement 6: Timely Response to Events

activities.title: Verify Human User Identification and Authentication
activities.description: Verify that OpenShift is configured to uniquely identify and authenticate all human users with multifactor authentication.

steps.description: Examine the OpenShift documentation for 'Understanding Authentication' and 'Configuring Identity Providers' to confirm the platform's capabilities.
Interview the OpenShift administration team to confirm that all user access is managed through a configured identity provider that enforces MFA.
Test the login process by attempting to authenticate to the OpenShift web console with a test user account, and verify that an MFA challenge is presented and required for successful login.

activities.title: Verify Software Process and Device Identification
activities.description: Verify each pod has a unique identity and authenticates to the API server.

steps.description: Examine the OpenShift documentation for 'Using service accounts' to confirm the mechanism for component identity.
Test API access from within a running pod using its default service account token to confirm it can authenticate successfully.

activities.title: Verify Account Management
activities.description: Verify user account management is centralized.

steps.description: Examine the identity provider configuration to confirm it is the single source for user management.
Interview an administrator to confirm that no local OpenShift users are created or managed.

activities.title: Verify Identifier Management
activities.description: Verify user identifiers are managed by the central IdP.

steps.description: Examine the OpenShift OAuth configuration to see how user identifiers are mapped from the IdP into the cluster.

activities.title: Verify Authenticator Management
activities.description: Verify secrets are protected by hardware-level security.

steps.description: Examine the OpenShift documentation for 'Understanding identity provider' and 'TLS security profiles' to confirm the platform's capabilities for protecting authenticators.
Interview the security team to confirm the KMS is backed by a FIPS 140-2 validated HSM.

activities.title: Verify Password Strength
activities.description: Verify password policies are enforced by the IdP.

steps.description: Examine the password policy documentation for the integrated identity provider.
Test the policy by attempting to set a non-compliant password for a test user in the identity provider.

activities.title: Verify PKI Certificate Management
activities.description: Verify the cluster uses a built-in PKI.

steps.description: Examine the secrets in the `openshift-kube-apiserver` namespace to identify the cluster's internal CAs and issued certificates.

activities.title: Verify Strength of Public Key-Based Authentication
activities.description: Verify the cluster's root of trust is hardware-backed.

steps.description: Examine the cluster's ingress certificate chain to confirm it is signed by the enterprise's HSM-backed CA.
Interview a member of the PKI team to confirm the operational procedures for the enterprise CA.

activities.title: Verify Authenticator Feedback
activities.description: Verify the login page obscures feedback.

steps.description: Test the login page by entering an incorrect username and an incorrect password, and verify the error message is generic and does not reveal which part was incorrect.

activities.title: Verify Unsuccessful Login Attempts
activities.description: Verify account lockout is handled by the IdP.

steps.description: Examine the account lockout policy in the integrated identity provider.
Test the policy by intentionally failing to log in multiple times with a test account and verifying the account is locked in the IdP.

activities.title: Verify System Use Notification
activities.description: Verify a warning banner is displayed.

steps.description: Examine the OpenShift web console login page to confirm the presence and content of the system use notification banner.

activities.title: Verify Strength of Symmetric Key-Based Authentication
activities.description: Verify etcd encryption keys are hardware-protected.

steps.description: Examine the OpenShift documentation for 'Encrypting etcd data' to confirm the use of GCM operation mode.

activities.title: Verify Authorization Enforcement
activities.description: Verify that OpenShift enforces authorization for all users based on assigned responsibilities and the principle of least privilege.

steps.description: Examine the OpenShift documentation for 'Using RBAC' to confirm the platform's capabilities.
Interview a developer and an administrator to understand the process for requesting and granting permissions.
Test the RBAC configuration by authenticating as a user with limited privileges and attempting to perform an administrative action. Verify the action is denied with a 'Forbidden' error.

activities.title: Verify Wireless Use Control
activities.description: Verify network policies restrict traffic from wireless segments.

steps.description: Examine the OpenShift documentation for 'Network security' to confirm the platform's capabilities for restricting network operations.

activities.title: Verify Mobile Code Control
activities.description: Verify only signed and trusted container images can be deployed.

steps.description: Examine the OpenShift documentation for 'Image configuration' and 'Managing pod security policies' to confirm the platform's capabilities.
Test the policy by attempting to deploy a pod with an unsigned container image and verifying the deployment is blocked.

activities.title: Verify Session Lock
activities.description: Verify web console sessions time out.

steps.description: Examine the OpenShift documentation for 'Configuring the internal OAuth server' to find the configured session inactivity timeout value.
Test the session lock by logging into the web console, remaining inactive for the configured timeout period, and verifying the session is terminated.

activities.title: Verify Remote Session Termination
activities.description: Verify sessions can be manually terminated.

steps.description: Examine the OpenShift documentation for 'Managing OAuth access tokens'.
Test termination by logging in with a user, identifying their `OAuthAccessToken`, deleting it as an administrator, and verifying the user's session is immediately invalidated.

activities.title: Verify Concurrent Session Control
activities.description: Verify concurrent sessions are managed by the IdP.

steps.description: Examine the concurrent session control policies in the integrated identity provider.

activities.title: Verify Auditable Events
activities.description: Verify detailed audit logs are generated.

steps.description: Examine the OpenShift documentation for 'Configuring audit log policies' to confirm the audit log policy is configured to log requests and responses at the metadata level.

activities.title: Verify Audit Storage Capacity
activities.description: Verify logs are forwarded to a SIEM with capacity monitoring.

steps.description: Examine the OpenShift documentation for 'Viewing audit logs' to confirm logs are being sent to the SIEM.
Interview the SIEM administration team to confirm that capacity alerts are configured for the log storage.

activities.title: Verify Response to Audit Processing Failures
activities.description: Verify log forwarding is resilient.

steps.description: Examine the log forwarding configuration to confirm that local buffering is enabled on the nodes.

activities.title: Verify Timestamps
activities.description: Verify nodes use a trusted time source.

steps.description: Examine the OpenShift documentation for 'Using PTP' to verify that `chronyd` is configured to use a trusted, internal NTP server.

activities.title: Verify Non-repudiation
activities.description: Verify audit logs link actions to unique identities.

steps.description: Examine a sample of audit log entries in the SIEM and trace the user and source IP for a given action back to an authenticated session from the identity provider.

activities.title: Verify Communication Integrity
activities.description: Verify all cluster communication is encrypted.

steps.description: Examine the OpenShift documentation for 'TLS security profiles' to confirm that TLS security profiles are set to a restrictive level.

activities.title: Verify Protection from Malicious Code
activities.description: Verify multiple layers of protection are active.

steps.description: Examine the OpenShift documentation for the 'Security Profiles Operator' to confirm that SELinux is in enforcing mode.
Interview the security team to review the runtime threat detection alerts generated by ACS.

activities.title: Verify Security Functionality Verification
activities.description: Verify compliance scanning is automated.

steps.description: Examine the OpenShift documentation for the 'Compliance Operator' to confirm that scans are scheduled to run continuously.

activities.title: Verify Software and Information Integrity
activities.description: Verify that OpenShift provides mechanisms to check the authenticity and integrity of software and configuration, with automated notifications.

steps.description: Examine the OpenShift documentation for the 'File Integrity Operator' and verify it is active and monitoring critical host paths.
Examine the configuration of Red Hat Advanced Cluster Security (ACS) to verify that an admission control policy is in place to block unsigned or un-scanned container images from being deployed.
Test the integrity controls by attempting to deploy a container image from an untrusted, unsigned registry. Verify that the deployment is blocked by the ACS admission controller.

activities.title: Verify Input Validation
activities.description: Verify the API server rejects malformed input.

steps.description: Test the API server by attempting to create a resource with a syntactically incorrect manifest file. Verify the API server rejects the request with a validation error.

activities.title: Verify Deterministic Output
activities.description: Verify operators enforce a deterministic state.

steps.description: Test the operator reconciliation loop by manually deleting a pod managed by a `Deployment`. Verify that the `Deployment`'s operator automatically creates a new pod to match the desired state.

activities.title: Verify Error Handling
activities.description: Verify error messages do not leak sensitive information.

steps.description: Examine the OpenShift documentation for 'Audit log view' and 'Audit log policy config' to confirm error handling procedures.

activities.title: Verify Session Integrity
activities.description: Verify session identifiers are secure.

steps.description: Examine the OpenShift documentation for 'Configuring an OIDC identity provider' to confirm session integrity procedures.

activities.title: Verify Protection of Audit Information
activities.description: Verify audit logs are stored immutably.

steps.description: Examine the OpenShift documentation for 'Cluster logging support' and interview the SIEM administration team to confirm that the storage for OpenShift audit logs is configured for write-once, read-many (WORM) immutability.

activities.title: Verify Information Confidentiality
activities.description: Verify data is encrypted at rest and in transit.

steps.description: Examine the OpenShift documentation for 'TLS security profiles' and 'Network bound disk encryption' to confirm data encryption procedures.

activities.title: Verify Information Persistence
activities.description: Verify procedures for data erasure.

steps.description: Examine the OpenShift documentation for 'Understanding persistent storage' and interview the system owner to review the documented procedures for decommissioning cluster nodes and verifying data erasure.

activities.title: Verify Use of Cryptography
activities.description: Verify the cluster is in FIPS mode.

steps.description: Examine the OpenShift documentation for 'Installing FIPS' to verify that FIPS mode is enabled for all nodes.

activities.title: Verify Network Segmentation
activities.description: Verify network policies enforce segmentation.

steps.description: Examine the OpenShift documentation for 'About disconnected environments' and the `NetworkPolicy` objects in a critical application's namespace to confirm a default-deny ingress policy is in place.

activities.title: Verify Audit Log Accessibility
activities.description: Verify logs are accessible in the SIEM.

steps.description: Examine the OpenShift documentation for 'Audit log view' and test the SIEM by performing a query for OpenShift API audit events and verifying that results are returned in near real-time.

activities.title: Verify Continuous Monitoring
activities.description: Verify security monitoring tools are active.

steps.description: Examine the OpenShift documentation for 'Cluster logging support', the 'Compliance Operator', and the ACS and SIEM dashboards to confirm that security events are being actively monitored.

activities.title: Verify Denial of Service Protection
activities.description: Verify resource limits are enforced.

steps.description: Examine the OpenShift documentation for 'Red Hat's Secure Software Development Lifecycle' and the `ResourceQuota` and `LimitRange` objects in application namespaces to confirm that CPU, memory, and storage limits are defined.
Test the limits by deploying an application that attempts to exceed its memory quota and verifying it is terminated by the platform.

activities.title: Verify Resource Management
activities.description: Verify critical components have guaranteed resources.

steps.description: Examine the OpenShift documentation for 'Controlling pod placement' and the pod definitions for critical components to confirm they have defined resource requests.

activities.title: Verify Control System Backup
activities.description: Verify backup procedures are in place.

steps.description: Examine the OpenShift documentation for 'Backup and restore overview' and the cluster's etcd backup configuration.
Interview an administrator to review the backup logs and confirm successful completion.

activities.title: Verify Control System Recovery and Reconstitution
activities.description: Verify a DR plan exists.

steps.description: Examine the OpenShift documentation for 'Backup and restore' and interview the system owner to review the documented disaster recovery plan.

activities.title: Verify Network and Security Configuration Settings
activities.description: Verify configuration is managed as code.

steps.description: Examine the OpenShift documentation for 'Network security' and the GitOps repository that contains the cluster configuration manifests to verify that all security settings are defined as version-controlled code.

activities.title: Verify Least Functionality
activities.description: Verify the principle of least privilege is enforced.

steps.description: Examine the OpenShift documentation for 'Cluster capabilities' and the cluster's `SecurityContextConstraints` and confirm that the default is `restricted`.
Test least functionality by attempting to deploy a pod that requires `privileged` access and verifying it is blocked by default.

activities.title: Verify Control System Component Inventory
activities.description: Verify the API provides a complete inventory.

steps.description: Examine the OpenShift documentation for 'Red Hat Security Data' and test the inventory capability by running `oc get nodes` and `oc get pods --all-namespaces -o wide`.
